file_content.text: Ah. Greetings, Lieutenant. I understand congratulations are in order.
Needles is neutralized, General.
Mission accomplished.
Tavus is going to run out of friends fast at this rate.
We're on the right track.
Don't sound so surprised.
You've done very well. Needles was a brilliant man--taking him down was no small feat.
I haven't informed Kardan yet, but I doubt he'll be upset. He and Needles never did see eye-to-eye.
Needles was insane--I doubt anyone saw eye-to-eye with him.
No surprise there.
I thought Kardan was close to everyone in Havoc?
Really?
Yes, but Needles less so than the others. Purely different ideologies, those two.
And yet, Tavus never had any problems with Needles. Perhaps that should've been my first warning.
The old man's feelings aren't my problem.
I couldn't care less.
Kardan happy can be very useful to us. An angry Kardan means trouble, even while in custody. Try to remember that.
And there's something else, Lieutenant. Tell me, what do you think of Sergeant Dorne?
Sergeant Dorne helped me when no one else would, General.
She's an exemplary officer.
Yes, your reception on Taris wasn't ideal. I'm glad you managed to find the one useful officer in the entire outpost.
She knows her regulations, that's for sure.
Dorne is a bit... uptight.
Sergeant Dorne really annoys me, sir.
I can't stand her.
That's unfortunate, Lieutenant.
I looked over her service record. Impressive stuff, I must say.
Were you aware that Dorne served with the Imperial military for almost two years, Lieutenant?
She told me she grew up in the Empire.
Yes, General.
Yes, the accent is a dead giveaway. Pure Dromund Kaas.
A personality like hers is a pretty strong clue to her background.
It definitely shows.
Yes, I suspect her life in the Empire involved no small amount of discipline.
Are you worried that Dorne is still working with the Imps?
Do you think she's a spy?
Not in the least, Lieutenant.
Sergeant Dorne earned more commendations in her two years of Imperial service than most soldiers earn in ten.
Since joining the Republic, she's earned two Medals of Valor, both for rescuing wounded soldiers under fire in enemy territory. This woman has led an exceptional career.
Someone with Sergeant Dorne's skills would make a great addition to my squad.
I could use her in Havoc.
I agree. Sergeant Dorne is Havoc Squad material, without question.
Good looks like Dorne's don't usually come with the uniform.
And she's gorgeous!
As professional as ever, I see. Please try to focus on the relevant details.
Exceptional women like me and Dorne should stick together.
We have a lot in common.
That's just what I had in mind, actually.
Nothing says an Imperial spy couldn't lead an exceptional career, General.
I still don't trust her.
The sergeant's loyalty to the Republic has been proven to my satisfaction.
I want Dorne in Havoc Squad, Lieutenant. Her service record is unmatched, and her assistance to you on Taris was beyond commendable.
Sergeant Dorne would make an excellent addition to Havoc Squad.
I'd be glad to have her.
I guess Dorne could probably come in handy.
Sure, why not?
It's settled, then. Congratulations, Lieutenant--you're halfway to a full squad.
I don't think so.
I've made my decision. Havoc Squad needs a medical officer, and Dorne's firsthand experience with the Imperials is invaluable.
I'll contact Colonel Gaff to notify him about the transfer. You should go and inform Sergeant Dorne yourself, Lieutenant. Contact me from your ship when you've finished. Garza out.
Come in, Lieutenant. This is General Garza. Do you copy?
I read you loud and clear, General.
Affirmative.
Yeah, I'm here.
I have things to do, Garza. Remember?
Go bother someone else.
Yes, as I recall, you have many duties--to me.
I understand you've just landed on Taris. I've already contacted our local regimental commander, Colonel Gaff, to secure his support.
Colonel Gaff doesn't know the specifics of your mission--only that he should assist you in every way possible. I'd like to keep it that way.
I'll keep quiet on the details, General.
Understood.
That's for the best, Lieutenant.
Do we know which of the Havoc traitors is hiding here?
Who's my target?
I'm afraid not. You'll have to depend on local intelligence gathering to determine your target's identity and location.
Is that all?
Yes, Lieutenant, there's more.
Taris is a dangerous and untamed wasteland. A Sith attack several centuries ago leveled every standing structure and virtually eradicated the local population.
Where cities once rivaled Coruscant, only swamps and ruins remain. Reclaiming and rebuilding the planet has become an important symbolic goal for the Senate.
If there's any way I can aid in the reconstruction, I'll do it.
I'll do what I can to help.
Of course. Just don't lose sight of your primary objective.
What else can you tell me?
I see vague mention of infectious parasites--apparently, Colonel Gaff works hard to withhold negative information about the reconstruction.
I couldn't care less about the Senate's "symbolic goals," Garza.
Does this really matter?
My briefings are not intended to entertain you.
That's all I have for you, Lieutenant. Report in when your operation is complete.
I'll contact you as soon as the job's done, General.
Roger that.
I'm ready to see this dangerous, untamed wasteland for myself.
Time for some fun.
I'll contact you when I contact you.
Don't hold your breath.
One traitor down, four to go.
Needles was only the start.
